alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 6:29PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wichita and northern Greeley Counties through 600 PM MDT/700 PM CDT/... At 527 PM MDT/627 PM CDT/, the public reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles south of Sharon Springs to 6 miles west of Modoc. Movement was southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Multiple automated sites in Southern Wallace and Southern Logan counties reported wind gusts of 35-45 mph. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of Wichita and northern Greeley Counties, including the following locations... Marienthal and Selkirk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
